title: Maple and Brown Sugar Oatmeal Recipe
description: Recreate maple and brown sugar oatmeal packets from scratch using this super quick and easy recipe that beats store-bought oatmeal any day.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Cereals Oatmeal Recipes Maple and Brown Sugar Oatmeal 4.4 (37) 32 Reviews 4 Photos Maple and brown sugar oatmeal is super easy to make. I was tired of buying the packages, so I decided to experiment and this is it! Submitted by Brandy Despang Updated on February 7, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 2 mins Cook Time: 6 mins Additional Time: 2 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 1 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 1 ½ cups water ¾ cup quick-cooking oats 1 tablespoon packed dark brown sugar 1 tablespoon maple syrup Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring water to a boil in a small pot. Add oats and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar and maple syrup. Let sit until desired thickness is reached, 2 to 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 74 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 334 Calories 4g Fat 68g Carbs 8g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 1 Calories 334 % Daily Value * Total Fat 4g 5% Saturated Fat 1g 4% Sodium 20mg 1% Total Carbohydrate 68g 25% Dietary Fiber 6g 22% Total Sugars 26g Protein 8g 16% Calcium 67mg 5% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 282mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Maple and Brown Sugar Oatmeal 01 of 04 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 04 Photo by  TxCin2 01/29/2025 I used Bob's Red Mill thick rolled oats, so they took 10 minutes to cook. I already know that the serving size on the package is too much for me, so I cut this down by half so it was 3/4 c of water and 3/8 c of oats. I did add the pinch of salt as directed on the package of oats. I cut the syrup and sugar down by half as well. This turned out a little too sweet for me. I probably could have gotten by with only one of the sweeteners, but then it wouldn't have been maple and brown sugar oatmeal. I saw other reviewers stated theirs turned out runny and thin, perhaps it was the use of quick cooking oats? I used a longer cooking thicker rolled oat and allowed a full 10 minutes of cook time according to the package directions. The portion was just right once I cut this in half. This was much better than those packets of instant flavored oats and I like being able to control the amount of sugar in it. 03 of 04 Photo by  Jkuk 02/27/2019 Really good. Just the right amount of sweetness. 04 of 04 Photo by  lutzflcat 06/16/2018 6.16.18 The brown sugar and maple syrup give the oatmeal just enough sweetness, but doesn’t overpower. Next time I’ll cut back just a bit on the amount of the water, husband thought it was a little runny, but that's just personal taste. Scaled the recipe to two servings, and this does make a big bowl of oatmeal; in this house, it was more like three servings. Garnished with some sliced banana and a sprinkle of brown sugar. This is quick and easy for sure! 1 You’ll Also Love Peachy Oatmeal 26 Ratings Blueberry Oatmeal 23 Ratings Banana Nut Oatmeal 46 Ratings Super Duper Oatmeal 42 Ratings Pumpkin Oatmeal 169 Ratings Peanut Butter and Maple Oatmeal 26 Ratings Hummingbird Carrot Cake Oatmeal 4 Ratings Rebecca's Instant Cinnamon Oatmeal 5 Ratings Bright-Idea Oatmeal 2 Ratings Quick-and-Easy Almond Milk Oatmeal with Raspberries Spiced Chai Overnight Oats 5 Ratings Sunflower Banana Oatmeal 6 Ratings Night-Before Oatmeal-In-A-Jar 6 Ratings Banana-Blueberry Oatmeal with Rosemary 2 Ratings Sweet Banana Almond Oatmeal 28 Ratings Overnight Slow Cooker Oatmeal 51 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar and maple syrup. Let sit until desired thickness is reached, 2 to 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
